Here's how the navbar looks on mobile, post #15335

/user_uploads/2/97/c5u9_inNczHps2c47g4SAENo/navbar-mobile.gif

The tricky bit here is that the name, count and description all have content based widths and the stream name and description have user defined content... We handle with flex and, while, there's probably scope for improvement on the flex properties... I think we should think more broadly about how we want this to look, especially for 2.2.

One thing we could do is just hide the description and sub count bellow 500px, and have everything after the stream name be a part of the click area for starting the search.
@Yash RE âœ¨ my main complaint with the look there is we're wasting a lot of space with horizontal padding around the gear menu.

In general or the right side in particular?

Here's a picture with the buddy list on the right side.
The right side especially, but probably all of those section could be the width of the top-left widget or maybe even a bit smaller.
Alright. Don't like the idea of putting things over the scrollbar, but I suppose we should use the space while we have it.
Hmm, the scrollbar we should ideally scope to not include the header area.
